name: AutumnLeaf
description:
The colors of a Finnish autumn morning captured and packed in a nice color scheme which is light orange/blue/green and doesn't strain the eye.

This scheme was created to serve more as a tool for users who work with code such as C/C++ or Perl. Also handy with XHTML/HTML/CSS and why not plain text too.

Rich syntax highlightings, cterm supported.

Screenshot here: http://safelyinrussia.com/tmp/miikka/autumnleaf.png
install_details:
A) UNIX/Linux: Download to ~/.vim/colors/.
B) Win32: Download to <vim directory>/vimfiles/colors/.

Open Vim, type :colors AutumnLeaf. If you like the theme, edit your _vimrc (Win) or .vimrc (Un*x) and add this line:
    colorscheme AutumnLeaf
thus making this scheme your default one.
